alert.note: Alert for Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 9:34AM EST until February 19 at 10:30AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Tioga County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 1030 AM EST. * At 933 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from Troupsburg to Keating Summit, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect hazardous road conditions. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from near Gaines to Mansfield. Route 15 from Mansfield to Lawrenceville. Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Wellsboro, Morris, Elkland, Westfield, Gaines, Millerton, Keeneyville, Leetonia, Leonard Harrison State Park, Tioga, Knoxville, Roseville, Osceola, Tioga Junction and Mansfield University. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
